column1: 1 ^ Dixit Dòminus Dòmino meo, «~Sede a dextrîs meîs, donec ponam inimícos tuos scabèllum pèdum tuórum.~»^ The Lord said to my Lord, "Sit thou at my right hand, until I should make thy enemies thy footstool."
2 ^ Virgam virtútis tuaĕ emìttet Dòminus ex Sióne~
column2: domináre in mèdio inimicórum tuórum. ^ The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion~
column3: rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

column1: 3 ^ Tecum princìpium in die virtútis tuaĕ, in splendóribus sanctórum~
column2: ex útero ante lucìferum gènui te. ^ With thee is the foundation in the day of thy strength, in the brightness of the saints~
column3: from the womb before the day star I begot thee.

column1: 4 ^ Jurávit Dòminus et non poĕnitébit eum, «~Tu ès sácerdos in aĕtèrnum secùndum órdinem Melchisedécis.~»^ The Lord hath sworn and shall not repent, "Thou art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedech."

column2: confrégit in die iraĕ suaĕ reges. ^ The Lord is at thy right hand~
column3: he hath broken kings in the day of his wrath.

column2: conqŭassábit cápita in terra multórum. ^ He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins~
column3: he shall crush the heads in the land of many.

column2: proptèrea exaltábit caput. ^ He shall drink of the torrent in the way~
column3: therefore shall he lift up the head.
